content:
Slicing Geospace

  • Subdividing interior space is even worse

    • Floors and suites of office buildings
    • Dilbert cubicles
    • Equipment closets
    • ìJoanís officeî
    • Relative descriptions

      • ìJust down the hall from the water fountainî
      • ìAbove and to the right of the bookshelfî

  • We employ an extremely rich vocabulary for describing interior space

  • Many different kinds of maps

    • They exist for a reason

  • Any single geospatial namespace is inadequate
